Recycling Scavenger Hunt: Organize a city-wide recycling scavenger hunt where residents are tasked with finding and properly disposing of specific items on a list. This could be a fun and interactive way to promote recycling and raise awareness about what can and cannot be recycled.

Recycling Art Contest: Host a recycling art contest where residents can submit their creative artwork made from recycled materials. This could be a great way to showcase the beauty and potential of recycled materials and encourage people to think more creatively about how they can reduce waste.

Community Composting: Set up community composting stations throughout the city where residents can bring their food scraps and other organic waste to be turned into nutrient-rich compost. This could be a great way to reduce the amount of waste that goes to landfills and promote sustainable gardening practices.

Recycling Education Workshops: Host a series of recycling education workshops where residents can learn more about the benefits of recycling, how to properly sort and prepare their recyclables, and what can and cannot be recycled in their city.

Recycling Rewards Program: Implement a recycling rewards program where residents can earn points or prizes for properly disposing of their waste. This could be a great way to incentivize people to recycle more often and make it a habit.
